intro: Empogona filiformistipulata, commonly known as the slender-stipule empogona, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, filiform stipules and small, clustered flowers with white to pale pink petals. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Empogona filiformistipulata is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological roles in its native habitats.
